sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email declining a meeting invitation
bad_output: nah cant make it. busy that day lol
reason_why_bad: Too informal, uses slang, no greeting or sign-off, provides no alternative or follow-up, unprofessional tone

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write a follow-up email after a job interview
bad_output: Hey, just checking if you've made a decision yet? I really need this job. Please let me know ASAP.
reason_why_bad: Sounds desperate, too casual, pressures the recipient, no reference to specific interview details, lacks professionalism

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to a client apologizing for a delayed shipment
bad_output: Sorry about the delay. It happens sometimes. Your stuff should arrive eventually.
reason_why_bad: Dismissive tone, no specific details about the delay or resolution, no timeline given, lacks empathy and professionalism

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email requesting time off
bad_output: I won't be in next week. Thanks.
reason_why_bad: No subject line format, no specific dates, no mention of coverage plan, too abrupt, doesn't ask for approval

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to a vendor negotiating a lower price
bad_output: Your prices are too high. We can get it cheaper elsewhere. Lower your price or we'll go to your competitor.
reason_why_bad: Aggressive and threatening tone, no specific ask, burns relationship, unprofessional negotiation tactic, no mention of mutual benefit

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email announcing a policy change
bad_output: New policy: everyone must be in the office 5 days a week starting Monday. No exceptions.
reason_why_bad: No context or rationale provided, no transition period, authoritarian tone, no channel for questions, no subject line structure

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write a cold outreach email to a potential partner
bad_output: Hi, I wanted to reach out because I think you should use our product. We're the best in the market. Let me know when you want to buy.
reason_why_bad: Self-centered pitch, no research about recipient, no value proposition for them, assumes sale, no specific ask or call to action

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write a resignation email
bad_output: I quit. This job was terrible and management is incompetent. Good luck finding a replacement.
reason_why_bad: Hostile and unprofessional, burns bridges, no notice period, no transition plan, emotionally charged

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email responding to a customer complaint
bad_output: We've never had this complaint before so the problem is probably on your end. Read the manual.
reason_why_bad: Blames the customer, dismissive, no empathy, no offer to help, condescending tone, will lose the customer

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email congratulating a team
bad_output: Good job on the project. It was about time we finished something on schedule.
reason_why_bad: Backhanded compliment, undermines the achievement, no specific praise, no recognition of individuals, demotivating tone

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to IT requesting software access
bad_output: I need access to the software NOW. This is urgent and I've been waiting too long. Please prioritize.
reason_why_bad: Demanding tone, no specific details about which software, no justification, no approval information, creates conflict

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
input: Write an email to a colleague asking for help

reason_why_bad: Delegates their own work without asking, no context about the presentation, no offer of reciprocity, assumes compliance

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.

sample_prompt: You write professional emails for business contexts.
